Subjective: Constipation for 3 months; Hard stools every 2-3 days; Abdominal cramps; Bloated stomach; Underweight, low appetite; No blood in stool; Tried olive oil for softening; No urinary issues; Regular menstruation; Sister has ulcerative colitis; Request: Wants to know if should be concerned and how to soften stools.
Objective: Abdomen: Normal bowel sounds, varying tympani, sensitive in lower left quadrant, dampening in lower left quadrant. No pain in upper abdomen, lower right quadrant, or renal lodges.
Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome, constipation-predominant. No signs of alarm.
Plan: 1. Prescribed psyllium fibre sachets, take daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks. 2. Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate results. 3. Safety net: Report worsening abdominal pain, fever, or blood in stool. 4. Discuss referral to dietitian next visit.
